meanings.definition: The practice of living as a hermit, typically for religious reasons.
meanings.sent1: Some people find solace in eremitisms, living alone in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The eremitisms of ancient monks often involved long periods of silence and meditation.
meanings.sent3: The town joked that Bob's eremitisms were so extreme, he even avoided his own reflection.
meanings.sent4: Her eremitisms were like a shield against the chaos of the world, keeping her inner peace intact.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of eremitisms lies in the simplicity and connection to nature it offers.

meanings.definition: The beliefs, practices, or lifestyle of a hermit.
meanings.sent1: Studying the eremitisms of different cultures can be fascinating.
meanings.sent2: His eremitisms included daily prayers and self-sufficiency in the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The eremitisms of the old man were a mystery to the villagers, who wondered what he did all day.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, her eremitisms stood out like a beacon of peace and simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The eremitisms of the wise sage were a source of inspiration for many seeking a quieter life.
